input.description: Specifies the virtual file space name (enclosed in curly braces) and the group name on the server that you want to query. For ex. if virtualfsname is ‘test’ and group is ‘group1’, the valid value of filespec will be {test}\group1.
The timeout value is seconds. This is the time after which the command will timeout regardless of whether the command execution is complete or not.

The fromnode option permits one node to perform commands for another node. A user on another node must use the set access command to permit you to query, restore, or retrieve files or images for the other node.
Use the inactive option to display both active and inactive objects: Valid values-true,false

Use the pitdate option with the pittime option to establish a point in time for which you want to display or restore the latest version of your backups. Files or images that were backed up on or before the date and time you specified, and which were not deleted before the date and time you specified, are processed. Backup versions that you create after this date and time are ignored. Date should be entered in MM/DD/YYYY format.

Use the pittime option with the pitdate option to establish a point in time for which you want to display or restore the latest version of your backups. Files or images that were backed up on or before the date and time you specify, and which were not deleted before the date and time you specify, are processed. Backup versions that you create after this date and time are ignored. This option is ignored if you do not specify pitdate option. Time should be entered in HH:MM:SS format. Note: The PITTIME option cannot be used without specifying the PITDATE option
Use the showmembers option to display all members of a group. Valid values-true,false

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" omit-xml-declaration="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <items> <item> <operation-name> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">query-group</xsl:text> </operation-name> <xsl:if test="string('${timeout secs}')!=''"> <timeout-secs> <xsl:value-of select="'${timeout secs}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </timeout-secs> </xsl:if> <command-options> <xsl:if test="string('${fromnode}')!=''"> <fromnode> <xsl:value-of select="'${fromnode}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </fromnode> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string('${inactive}')='true'"> <inactive /> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string('${pitdate}')!=''"> <pitdate> <xsl:value-of select="'${pitdate}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </pitdate> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string('${pittime}')!=''"> <pittime> <xsl:value-of select="'${pittime}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </pittime> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string('${showmembers}')='true'"> <showmembers /> </xsl:if> </command-options> <command-arguments> <xsl:if test="string('${filespec}')!=''"> <filespec> <xsl:value-of select="'${filespec}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </filespec> </xsl:if> </command-arguments> </item> </items> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Utility to create items xml for Query Group process.
